title: The Ethics of Machine Learning Algorithms: From Problem Definition to Data Labeling

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic machine learning concepts, possessing digital literacy
context.additional_context: Targeting professionals in medical/legal/technical fields, aimed at strengthening ethical dilemma analysis capabilities

learning_goals: Learners can explain the social impacts of bias in the process of defining "correct answers" in machine learning systems across three dimensions.
Learners can analyze cases requiring moral judgment in the stages of problematization, data collection (databasing), and labeling.
Learners can utilize an ethical considerations mapping tool in algorithm design by applying William James’s concept of "genuine options."
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
